TITLE: Biden’s climate chief says clean energy spending is winning over Americans
SUMMARY: Ali Zaidi says a surge in clean energy manufacturing and renewable power rollout is drawing support, although many people appear unaware of the historic investments made by the Biden administration.

TITLE: The fossil-fuel-promoting agency that Biden seems powerless to stop
SUMMARY: The Export-Import Bank’s investments in overseas oil and gas projects have continued even after advisers backed by the president voiced concern about the impact on climate change.

TITLE: Biden’s EPA postponing major piece of power plant climate rule
SUMMARY: The change comes as utilities express concern about grid reliability.

TITLE: Musk’s Tesla enters the mainstream as it embraces Biden’s EV charger money
SUMMARY: An analysis of public records shows Tesla has won the highest percentage of electric vehicle charging awards of any company from the president's infrastructure law.

TITLE: Gas export pause could scramble Biden’s chances in Pennsylvania
SUMMARY: Democratic Sens. Bob Casey and John Fetterman both argued the pause could hurt their state.

TITLE: A bureaucratic printer jam holds up a major Biden climate rule
SUMMARY: A regulation cracking down on oil and gas pollution is finally being published March 8, ending a three-month delay that gave rule watchers heartburn.

TITLE: Why a clean energy giant based in Florida is battling a green project in New England
SUMMARY: No one in the U.S. builds more solar and wind farms than NextEra Energy. It’s waging ferocious battles to keep the crown.

TITLE: Kemp: Biden's electric vehicle push spawned a backlash
SUMMARY: Georgia has drawn billions of dollars in investments from carmakers Hyundai and Rivian for new EV manufacturing plants in the state.

TITLE: Biden's big bet on EVs is poised to take a detour
SUMMARY: Slowing electric car sales, anxious union workers and the president’s campaign difficulties in Michigan are complicating one of his most ambitious climate policies.

TITLE: Trump vs. an emerging Republican climate strategy
SUMMARY: "We’re not dependent on a standard-bearer outside of the House," insists Rep. John Curtis (R-Utah), who founded the 82-member Conservative Climate Caucus.

TITLE: Federal agencies scramble to finish Biden’s rules — and protect his legacy from Trump
SUMMARY: Green groups don’t want regulations to fall prey to rollbacks as they did when Donald Trump won the presidency.

TITLE: Biden vs. Trump: Do young climate voters care?
SUMMARY: Biden, who signed the biggest climate law in U.S. history, has angered environmentalists by approving fossil fuel projects. Now, the head of one group says, "I’m worried about getting climate activists back."

TITLE: Dems cheer push for lower fuel prices. GOP warns of ‘asthma attacks’ in California
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden's pause on new export permits for natural gas is scrambling Washington's usual energy and climate debate.

TITLE: ‘Entire timetable at risk’: Rich countries' squabbling undermines historic climate deal
SUMMARY: Squabbles involving the EU, Russia, Turkey and the United States are holding up the launch of a board that's supposed to oversee aid to communities wracked by disasters.

TITLE: House Dems game out climate messaging at policy retreat
SUMMARY: The party is gearing up for the 2024 election with a series of legislative accomplishments under its belt, but many lawmakers fear voters haven't felt the policy wins.

TITLE: Departure at critical energy regulator threatens to stymie clean power
SUMMARY: Allison Clements’ decision to exit the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission could leave the agency in a bind as it tries to update rules needed to prepare the grid for a green power buildout.

TITLE: ‘Somewhat terrified’: A key Biden official gets candid on Trump’s agenda
SUMMARY: Eric Beightel, one of the Biden administration’s top infrastructure officials, worries that the ex-president’s return would be “catastrophic” for clean energy projects — especially offshore wind.

TITLE: Biden needs his young climate activists. But they’re angry about the war in Gaza.
SUMMARY: The tension is just one example of the growing divide between the president and his progressive base over his staunch support for Israel.

TITLE: Podesta to take on John Kerry's climate role
SUMMARY: News of the decision earned praise from Biden's environmental allies.

TITLE: The gas stove fight finally flames out
SUMMARY: A new Energy Department regulation would modestly tighten efficiency requirements for some gas stoves.

TITLE: The world's biggest meat processor — a major polluter — is coming to Wall Street
SUMMARY: JBS wants to join the New York Stock Exchange. The move could lead to rapid deforestation, critics say.

TITLE: Biden reins in gas exports that have raised both US prestige and climate fears
SUMMARY: “We can’t keep building and building and building.”

TITLE: White House gas export review to freeze new projects for more than a year
SUMMARY: The White House is expected to make the announcement Friday, though that could slip to early next week depending on last-minute planning.

TITLE: US rethinks gas exports, spooking Europe
SUMMARY: The EU is banking on Washington approving major new LNG projects. The Biden administration might not play ball.

TITLE: End of an era: Who comes after Kerry?
SUMMARY: Potential successors include Kerry deputy Sue Biniaz, Washington Gov. Jay Inslee and longtime political operative John Podesta.

TITLE: No more going wobbly in climate fight, Trump supporters vow
SUMMARY: For all his bombast, the former president's agencies hesitated to rewrite federal climate reports or install loyalists atop key science agencies. Some of his allies expect that to change.

TITLE: John Kerry to step down as Biden climate envoy
SUMMARY: The veteran diplomat helped craft the 2015 Paris climate agreement, and more recently led the U.S. team at COP28 in Dubai.

TITLE: Congress approves resolution against Biden EV charger plans
SUMMARY: The measure targets a limited waiver from Buy America rules. Democrats and the White House say it would backfire.

TITLE: Biden’s aides weigh climate test for natural gas exports
SUMMARY: Biden faces growing pressure from environmental groups to live up to his pledge to transition away from fossil fuels.

TITLE: ‘It’s a scary time’ as world shatters temperature record
SUMMARY: And 2024 may bring more of the same.
